abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project was
            unsatisfactory. The lessons learned include: 1) Project
            objectives need to be more clearly defined, and targets and
            monitoring indicators well thought-out and understood. 2)
            Project financing plan should assess Borrower's ability
            to meet counterpart funding requirement under varying
            macroeconomic conditions. 3) There must be good
            macroeconomic conditions and proper support for on-farm
            investments, as well as technical assistance for new
            irrigation farmers to adequately assimilate the change from
            non-irrigated to irrigated farming. 4) New institutional and
            management concepts must be clearly accepted and
            enthusiastically endorsed by the client leadership rather
            than just being a condition of the loan. 5) Implementation
            responsibility must be clearly defined and sufficiently
            funded. 6) Bank support and supervision, including
            sufficient funding for supervision, should continue until
            the end of the project and not dwindle after the major
            disbursements are completed. 7) In future irrigation sector
            projects, careful efforts should be made to measure and
            clearly define the initial ambient conditions so that
            effective evaluation of project impacts can be made.
